Package View

Class gameView

  • java.lang.Object
    • View.gameView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer
    public class gameView
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Observer
    View part of the MVC design pattern. This takes in all the data given by the model and updates what the player sees. It also listens for player input and passes that to the controller as appropriate.
    Author:
    Wes Rodgers, TianZeHu

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      gameView()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void checkDeath()
      checks for player and enemy death
      void checkWin()  
      boolean gameStarted()
      returns whether the game has started or not
      int getGameClock()
      returns the current tick of the game clock
      javafx.stage.Stage getStage()
      getter for the stage
      void incrementGameClock()
      increments the game clock by one
      void setAnimationTimer​(javafx.animation.AnimationTimer animationTimer)
      passes in the animation timer so the view can pause the game engine
      void setClicked​(javafx.scene.control.Button button)
      sets up the listener for the initial button to start the game
      void setupMouseClickListeners()
      sets up the event listeners for player mouse clicks, sword swing on left click and bow attack on right
      void setupMovementListeners()
      sets up listeners for key press and key release so we can tell when a combination of keys are pressed and move diagonally as appropriate.
      void startGame​(GameModel model)
      starts up the game, creates the map and sets appropriate class variables adds this view as an observer to the model and updates the screen when the model changes every tick
      void update​(java.util.Observable model, java.lang.Object area)
      redraws things on screen when the model updates and notifies us this is basically our animation engine, runs once a tick on the fact that the player position gets updated once per tick even if they didn't move or attack
      void updateCharacterPosition()
      updates the player's position in the area
      void updateEnemyCollision()
      calls methods to determine whether an enemy collided with the player, does damage if so.
      void updateEnemyPosition()
      updates the enemies' positions in the area
      void updateProjectiles()
      updates the location of and collision of projectiles on the map

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
